CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 27, reads: "Brake Testing - Carl Miller, of the Rent-A-Car Company, 6107 Broad Street, East Liberty, leaved the school bus after inspecting the Wright Gravity Emergency Stop recently when a public demonstration was held at Fifth Avenue and Saw Mill Run Boulevard, and attracted many commercial haulers, bus owners, school and safety officials. The Emergency Stop has been tabbed with William Wright, its inventor, as the brake to halt runaway buses, tractor-trailers and other vehicles.  The bus, used that day for demonstration purposes, is a regular school bus in McMurry District of Washington County and just recently was equipped with the brake. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Carl Miller exiting bus inscribed "Townsend Bus Co. Distributor Wright Gravity Emergency Stop" with another man on right
